meanings.definition: To remove or gather by scraping.
meanings.sent1: She was scraping the paint off the wall with a scraper.
meanings.sent2: I always start by scraping the ice off my car windshield in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The cat was scraping its claws on the scratching post, thinking it was a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like scraping nails on a chalkboard, making everyone cringe.
meanings.sent5: The sound of scraping metal echoed through the garage as he worked on his project.

meanings.definition: To rub or scrape (a surface) with something hard or rough.
meanings.sent1: He was scraping the mud off his shoes before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: The chef was scraping the burnt bits off the bottom of the pan.
meanings.sent3: The kids were scraping their knees on the pavement while learning to ride their bikes.
meanings.sent4: The wind was scraping against the windows, creating an eerie sound.
meanings.sent5: She could hear the scraping of branches against the roof during the storm.

meanings.sent1: The scraping of the chair against the floor interrupted the meeting.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the scraping of the shovel against the pavement outside.
meanings.sent3: The scraping of the fork against the plate made everyone at the table cringe.
meanings.sent4: The scraping of the pencil sharpener echoed in the quiet classroom.
meanings.sent5: The scraping of the knife against the cutting board was rhythmic and soothing.

meanings.definition: A small piece or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: She found a scraping of chocolate at the bottom of the bowl.
meanings.sent2: There was a scraping of butter left on the plate after breakfast.
meanings.sent3: He only had a scraping of paint left in the can.
meanings.sent4: The chef added a scraping of nutmeg to the soup for extra flavor.
meanings.sent5: The scraping of crumbs on the table attracted a line of ants.
